eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: Blaze follows Leizi to Baizao in search of the truth of her origins. As all of Baizao prepares for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, a feeling of unease permeates the city. Blaze visits a small eatery, where she enjoys a familiar dish.

attributes.content: Wait a minute! I'm busy!
attributes.name: Voice from the Kitchen

attributes.content: Oh. All you ordered was a bowl of plain noodles. It's on the house!
attributes.name: Voice from the Kitchen

attributes.text: I'll be leaving the money on the counter. Bye.

attributes.content: Thank you, come again!
attributes.name: Voice from the Kitchen

attributes.text: Eating so little for lunch at that age—what gives?
Too many colors blind the eyes, too many flavors dull the tongue—one must not indulge in the desire for food.
Didn't you just eat the one bowl of plain noodles?
I'm not like you—I prefer my food light and simple. I never add any seasonings when I eat—no salt, vinegar, chili, scallions, garlic, or spices at all.
When I'm eating, I want to taste the food itself. If the basics are even slightly less than fresh, my taste buds will detect it instantly.
Judging by your mandarin robes... you're a Deputy Minister with the Judicial Review Office, aren't you? Your tongue must be the greatest judge under Heaven.
Haha. You have a way with words.
When next you feel you've been wronged, come find me at the Judicial Review Office. My name is Yu Cheng.
I... won't need to trouble your magisterial greatness with that sort of thing. I am but a humble officer of the Ministry of Rites. I'm not often wronged.
Well, come see me anyway. I'll treat you to a bowl of noodles. What is your name, young man?

attributes.content: Hey, Jiang! I'm here!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Coming, coming! What'll it be today, Liu?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I'll have the usual. Any specials today?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Well, persimmons are in season. We also got a fresh batch of chestnuts today. You can either eat them raw—nice and crispy, or cooked—sweet and tender. How about stewed beast belly with chestnuts and then some osmanthus-flavored dried persimmon for dessert?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Nice. Alright, I'll try that then.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: By the way, that sign we fixed for your restaurant a while back...
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Don't worry. I checked with our chef. This meal is on the house.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You've taken care of all our carpentry work the past few years. Treating you to a few meals is the least we can do.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Hahaha. You're too kind!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: He's really a great cook, the greatest under Heaven, I'd say. I can't find food this good anywhere else!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: That wooden talisman I gave him, I meant it! He was too modest to accept the gift!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Come on! Enough already!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: We're just a little old eatery. It's you who keeps us in business. You don't need to flatter us like that.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: By the way, where is that young chef of yours? I didn't see him sitting outside and chatting with the guests today.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Don't even bring him up—he's been sulking since early this morning.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: There's this famous food critic going around lately, taking advantage of the buzz from the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, you know? I hear she's visiting all the hidden little eateries in town, rating them one by one in the newspapers.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I know, I know! I hear she published an article reviewing taverns in Baizao. She's even writing a book, says she wants to compile all the best recipes from Baizao, past and present.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: She calls herself, 'The Wandering Foodie' or something like that?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: She's certainly ambitious—Baizao has countless taverns, and these places have been making their dishes for generations. To write a book about them, she'll need a wealth of knowledge and a stomach big enough for all that food!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Exactly... But I hear the book she's working on, Baizao Cuisine & Food Culture, already earned some praise from the head chefs of the Four Great Restaurants. And none of them have anything bad to say about her reviews.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Rumor has it, she's dropping in here today.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Well, you have nothing to worry about. With your chef's cooking, even the harshest critic will have nothing to criticize, right?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: You know his temper. Whether the reviews are good or bad, he can't stand people talking about his food.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: (Whisper) He says he doesn't want to get into a cooking competition, but that's just because he's afraid he'll lose.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Alright. That's enough of that!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Haha. The only thing I'm worried about is people discovering this place, so I won't be able to get a table here anymore.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Knock on wood. Oh. Another customer!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Hey, look, the two of you coming right at this hour.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: We're right across from the Judicial Review Office. I guess it's kind of become your unofficial cafeteria.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: If it wasn't for this restaurant, I would have resigned and moved home ages ago!
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Don't say such things. We have a duty! How could you think of resigning?
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: What's up? Why so serious?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: It's the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, of course! The busiest time of the year for the Office. I haven't had a good night's sleep in a month—who can keep going like this?
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: The precautions are necessary, though. There are so many tourists here now. If something bad were to happen, it would be a disaster.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: No matter how careful we are... there's just too much going on. Something is bound to happen.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Hey. Enough shop talk. Just enjoy the food.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: You think we're talking about work because we want to? Ugh!
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: By the way, did you hear about the Ding Feng Lou case?
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: What case? If there's something to say, just say it—why all the secrecy?
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: I'm not trying to be secretive—this case is just downright eerie.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: On the 15th of last month, when Ding Feng Lou was busiest, every one of its hundred or so stoves were burning all day and late into the night.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: That night, one of the stoves caught fire, and the staff could not put it out. A handful of chefs were injured.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: The Originium pipe sprung a leak, was it? That's nothing new.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Well, the investigators could not determine whether the pipe had been tampered with or not.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Hundreds of people have access to that kitchen. Who knows if someone did something?
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: You must know that Ding Feng Lou is the most famous restaurant in Baizao, and the organizer of the Feast.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: The thing that makes this incident particularly strange is that it happened on the 15th day of the month, and the fire started on the hundredth stove. Some say they saw a strange silhouette amidst the flames.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Let's stick to the facts, yes? We don't need to fabricate things here.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: I'm telling you the truth! Many people said they saw it!
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: The work you do at the Judicial Review Office is pretty interesting. Listening to you talk about your cases is like reading a detective novel.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Come now. We're hardly authors here. It's just that whenever a case drags on for a few weeks without progress, I have nightmares about it.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Actually, now that you mention it, I also heard about a strange case, recently.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: There's nothing supernatural about it. It's just plain weird.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Oh? Another juicy story? Do tell!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: I really shouldn't divulge too many details about this.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: You can't tease us like that! The suspense is killing me!
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: This is a matter of great importance. The place where this incident occurred is truly significant!
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: It was the Mr. Ning's manor, former Minister of Rites.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: My shifu has been investigating this case for a while now. I've only heard an overview. He won't tell me more.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Mr. Ning has been retired for several years now. He's in the process of leaving Baizao and moving back to his hometown in Jiangnan. But a few days ago, a strange thief broke into his mansion.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Nothing was stolen, and no one was hurt. But in one of the guest rooms, there was a painting of a Xian hanging on the wall, and someone used melted honey to draw a line across the Xian's mouth.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Of course, the mansion was heavily guarded, but the thief seemed to know the layout very well.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: And that thief—whether down to incredible skill or sheer experience—left no trace behind. My shifu and the others have their hands full trying to crack the case.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Sealing the lips with honey? Isn't that from the 'Legend of the Stove God'? It ensures the Stove God will 'say more good things than bad'. The thief vandalized a painting, but didn't steal anything of value. They don't care for money, so did they have some other motive?
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: What motive could they have had? Minister Ning is an honorable mandarin. He has a decades-long record of dutiful public service. Who could have any issue with him?
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Regardless, he is an important court mandarin. The ransacking of his manor is no small matter, especially at a time like this.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: It's our greatest fear, come true.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Oh! Hey! I just thought of something!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: You scared me! What's the thought?
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: I just remembered that I also saw something weird a few days ago, right in this very restaurant!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: It was three days ago, I was here eating when a real strange customer walked in.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: He looked to be on the older side, and he was still wearing a prison outfit, as if he had just been released by the Judicial Review Office.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: He sat down and ordered twenty bowls of white rice, nothing else. He downed them in no time flat!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: That's... all you're going to eat?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Eating all that rice is bound to make you choke. Why don't we whip up two little entrees for you, and a bowl of soup. On the house.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Strange Customer

attributes.content: It's Dahuang rice, nice and fresh, the finest on the land. What other food could I possibly need?
attributes.name: Strange Customer

attributes.content: I've filled my belly. I've no need for any free dishes. Check, please!
attributes.name: Strange Customer

attributes.content: After the funny fella finished eating, he grabbed all twenty empty bowls and walked out of the restaurant. He kept walking until he reached the Judicial Review Office. He threw the pile of bowls at the door of the office, and yelled—
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: 'I'm the one who set the fire in the scrollery!'
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Well, I'm sure you know more about it than me, especially with my terrible memory. Who was that guy anyway? What happened to him in the end?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: There's no way I could discuss something like that with you...
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Shhh! There are civilians at the next table over!
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Don't worry about them. I heard that lady speaking Victorian. I think they're foreigners. They don't understand what we're saying anyway.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: (In perfect Yanese) Laoban, diancan!
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: 'Red Silk Special,' 'Mala Tofu,' 'Soft Yellow Shells,' 'Autumn Casserole,' and 'Jade Surprise'...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: ...and that's all she ordered.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Is she trying to challenge us?
attributes.name: Grumpy Voice

attributes.content: She seems very polite. She just looked at the menu and picked out these dishes. Didn't look like she was asking for trouble.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You think she might be that food critic, the one who wrote 'Baizao Cuisine & Food Culture'?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: What kind of food critic comes in and orders nothing but tofu?!
attributes.name: Grumpy Voice

attributes.content: Relax, chef, relax.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You know how things are going here, business-wise. The future of our restaurant hinges upon this very moment!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You have to do your best. The dishes must be flawless!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: The Victorian woman pulls up a chair and two jugs of wine and sits at the table with the two mandarins of the Judicial Review Office.
She casually pours each a glass of wine; its rich, sweet aroma soon fills the table.
Please, drink and enjoy! This wine was meant for sharing!
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: Aiai, so what happened next? What became of the weirdo who threw the empty rice bowls?
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: Good lady, what you just heard was nothing more than idle diner's chatter.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Whatever you do, please do not share it with anyone else.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Huh? But you haven't finished the story yet. Where's the cliffhanger? Where's the 'stay tuned for the next episode'?
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: I am a mandarin of the Judicial Review Office, madam. I'm not a storyteller in the teahouse.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: What a coincidence! I have a good friend who works there too.
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: And here I was, thinking everybody at the Judicial Review Office was stuffy, pretentious, and tight-lipped.
attributes.name: Victorian Tourist?

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *ahem*...
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Dear madam, have you come to Yan all by yourself? Are you here on vacation?
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Let's not be so formal. My Yanese name is Huang, or Blaze in Victorian.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: And yes... I guess you could say I'm here on vacation.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I haven't met many Victorians who speak Yanese as well as you do. Have you lived in Yan previously?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Haha. Actually, no. But I'm not a hundred percent Victorian. My father is Yanes—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Three rules, you say?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes, if you can't follow these rules, I won't be able to take you back to Baizao.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: Okay, okay. Lay 'em on me.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: First, be wary of strangers. Do not, of your own volition, take actions that are unnecessary.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: What do you take me for? A three-year-old? I know that. What else?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Second, do not tell anyone that you are an Infected.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: Do I really need you to tell me that?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Third...
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: Do not, under any circumstances, tell anyone about your father.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: ...Okay.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze, you are an important witness in all of these major cases… as well as an important piece of evidence.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: I need your cooperation, and in return, I will guarantee your safety.
attributes.name: Leizi

attributes.content: What's that about your dad?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Errr... I'm here to visit some family... and I'm on vacation. Haha.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Well, madam, you came at the perfect time. The Feast of a Hundred Delicacies is about to begin! All Baizao's restaurants compete to serve the best dishes. This is the time of year when you can try the tastiest food!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Really? Do you have any Baizao delicacies you can recommend, or maybe a restaurant or two?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Baizao doesn't have any signature dishes, or 'Baizao delicacies', as you put it. Instead, you'll find that every single dish you eat in Baizao makes a delicacy.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Ah, that makes sense! I didn't make the connection until now that Baizao means hundred stoves in Victorian!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You know what they say, 'To the people, food is heaven.' Yes, the name 'Baizao', bestowed ages ago by the reigning True Lung, means to tend all cooking stoves under heaven.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Later, someone says 'Exquisite food demands meticulous preparation.' See, fine food doesn't just fill your stomach, it soothes your soul.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: There are different dishes for every season and every region. The best chefs? They have a wealth of knowledge, and the power of the gods, at their fingertips.
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Please. Let's eat. Enough fooling around with foreign tourists.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: Order up!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Do you have some special fondness for tofu, or...?
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: Hmm? These are all tofu dishes? They have different names, so I had no idea.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Who would have thought that Yan had so many different kinds of tofu?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Whatever. There's more than enough tofu for everyone. We'll enjoy it all together. Isn't that the custom here in Yan, after all?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Alright, let's dig in!
attributes.name: Regular Customer

attributes.content: What's this? I don't remember ordering a dessert...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Did you send out the food? Does she like it?
attributes.name: Grumpy Voice

attributes.content: Actually, she didn't really eat much. She gave most of it away to the other customers.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Grumpy Voice

attributes.content: Settle down. She might be feeling out the ambiance, you know.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Just calm down. Let's see what happens.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: So what is this 'Feast of a Hundred Delicacies' you keep talking about?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You may speak fluent Yanese, madam, but there are clearly gaps in your knowledge of our culture.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: The Feast of a Hundred Delicacies happens every year in Mid-Autumn, when the True Lung convenes meetings with mandarins at all levels to discuss state affairs.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: If it's just a bunch of government meetings. Why is it called the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Now, that has a beautiful origin story.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Many years ago, the True Lung at the time held a birthday banquet, and all the mandarins presented him with gifts, including all manner of rare treasures from all across Yan.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: But there was one mandarin, a young Assistant Minister from the Ministry of Revenue, who gave the True Lung a bowl of 'Pearl Jade Soup'.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: The True Lung lifted the lid off the bowl, only to find a clump of rotten cabbage leaves and a scant few grains of brown rice floating in some water.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: The True Lung was enraged, demanding, 'What is the meaning of this?!' The Assistant Minister replied, 'There was a flood in Jiangqi this year, so we had a terrible harvest. What you see in the bowl here is what the peasants have been eating every day.'
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Speaking up for what's right—that's what any good mandarin should do.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Still, doing it to the True Lung's face, on his birthday like that, takes some serious guts.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes. The surprising thing is, the True Lung did not punish the young mandarin—he praised him and ordered that all other mandarins follow his example in advocating for the people.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: The True Lung ordered cuts to the court budget and used those funds for disaster relief. He built embankments to guard against future floods, and Jiangqi was saved.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Yes, and the following year, the mandarins presented the True Lung with a bowl of sumptuous 'Fortune Soup' to show him that the finneries were thriving.
attributes.name: Exhausted Judicial Official

attributes.content: *ahem*...
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: In summation, the annual banquet became a tradition, called the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, held every year during the Mid-Autumn Festival.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: And all restaurants in the city serve dishes from the traditional Hundred Delicacies menu, welcoming all the people to join in the celebration.
attributes.name: Stern Judicial Official

attributes.content: Oh. The Yanese really know food, don't they?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: This little shop here is a great example. It may look ordinary, but it serves top notch eats! Just look how many different types of tofu they can make! Amazing!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Then again, these cakes here... they taste different to the ones I've had before, and not in a good way. I think something's not quite right with them.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Huh? Why's everyone gone silent?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Was it you?!
attributes.name: Irritable Youth

attributes.content: You're the one criticizing my food?!
attributes.name: Irritable Youth
